Class GoodbyePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • GoodbyePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GoodbyePanel
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    Panel used to display the goodBye screen which is a gif
    Version:
    5.0.0 06.09.2015 Alex - Updated Time Spent as of May 22, 2015: 1.5 Hours - setting up class - making the gif actually animate - implimenting key and mouse listener
    Author:
    A Barkin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) javax.swing.JPanel contentPane
      contentPane - JPanel used to hold the gif
      (package private) boolean enter
      enter - boolean used to register an enter so that it skips the goodBye screen
      (package private) javax.swing.JFrame frame
      frame - JFrame used to hold the panel which holds the gif
      (package private) javax.swing.JLabel imageLabel
      imageLabel - JLabel used to hold the gif so that it still animates
      (package private) long startTime
      startTime - long used to hold the time so the gif only runs for a select amount of time
